intro: Lilac suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented lilac, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its fragrant, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet and features heart-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant. The flowers bloom in late spring, adding a pleasant fragrance to the garden.
